pygcdl package

Module contents

class pygcdl.PyGeoCDL(url_base: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Object used to interact with GeoCDL through python

Parameters:

url_base (str, optional) – IP address of the server hosting the GeoCDL. Defaults to address of the Ceres service node.

download_points_subset(dsvars, dates=None, years=None, months=None, days=None, t_crs=None, resolution=None, t_geom=None, out_format='csv', grain_method='strict', validate_method='strict', ri_method='nearest', dsn='.', req_name=None)[source]
download_polygon_subset(dsvars: DataFrame | ndarray | list | dict, dates: list[str] | str | None = None, years: list[str] | str | None = None, months: list[str] | str | None = None, days: list[str] | str | None = None, t_crs: str | None = None, resolution: float | None = None, t_geom: str | list[str] | GeoDataFrame | None = None, out_format='geotiff', grain_method='strict', validate_method='strict', ri_method='nearest', dsn='.', req_name=None)[source]

Download raster data clipped to polygon boundaries

Parameters:

  • dsvars (Union[pandas.DataFrame, numpy.ndarray, list, dict]) – Specifies the datasets and variables requested

  • dates (Optional[list[str]]) – List of dates requested.

  • years (Optional[str]) – List of years requested. Ignored if dates is specified

  • months – List of months requested. Ignored if dates is specified

  • days (Optional[str]) – List of days requested. Ignored if dates is specified

  • t_crs (Optional[str]) – Target CRS. Also used as the crs of the uploaded geometry if no geographic metadata is included.

  • t_geom – Target geometry, either a GUID, and list of GUIDs, or a gpd.GeoDataFrame. If not set, GeoCDL returns the entire spatial extent of the dataset.

download_subset(dsvars, dates=None, years=None, months=None, days=None, t_crs=None, resolution=None, t_geom=None, out_format=None, grain_method='strict', validate_method='strict', ri_method='nearest', dsn='.', req_name=None)[source]
get_dataset_info(dsid)[source]

Returns all metadata for the dataset with the given dataset ID. The metadata are returned as a dictionary of key: value pairs.

infer_endpoint(geom)[source]
list_datasets()[source]

Retrieves the ID and name of all available GeoCDL datasets. The dataset information is returned as a dictionary in which the dataset IDs are the keys and the dataset names are the values.

upload_geometry(geom: PathLike | str | GeoDataFrame)[source]

Uploads a user geometry to the GeoCDL REST API and returns a geometry upload ID to use in subset requests.

Parameters:

geom (Union[os.PathLike, str, gpd.GeoDataFrame]) – Geometry to upload

Returns:

A Geometry Upload ID (GUID), or list of GUIDs to use in subsequent requests

Return type:

Union[str, list]
